data: PED ED/NEURO Ischemic Stroke Thrombolysis Treatment

Confirm Suspicion of Stroke – Consider Mimics
Determine Acuity:
- Time last seen well
- Symptoms improving or progressing
Page Neurology And Radiology Immediately

Alteplase (tPA) inclusion criteria:
- Diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing disabling neurologic deficit
- Time from last known well, less than 4.5 hour (extended in select patients)
Absolute exclusion criteria:
- Source of active hemorrhage or risk of major hemorrhage after tPA
- Hemorrhage on brain imaging

Alteplase relative exclusion criteria:
Historical
- History of intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH)
- Stroke or serious neurotrauma in preceding 3 month
- Major surgery (cardiac, ortho, abdominal, thoracic) in preceding 14 day
- Arterial puncture at non-compressible site in preceding 7 day
Clinical
- Symptoms suggestive of subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)
- Symptoms due to other non-stroke etiology - seizure, hypoglycemia/hyperglycemia
- Hypertension refractory to treatment such that target of 95th percentile+15% cannot be achieved
- Taking Direct oral anticoagulants (DOAC)
Imaging
- Early signs of extensive infarction
Lab
- Glucose less than 2.7 or greater than 22.2 mmol/L
- Elevated aPTT
- INR greater than 1.7
- Platelet less than 100,000 / cubic mm

Alteplase precautions;
Stroke Mimics
- Migraine
- Seizure
- Bell’s Palsy
- Syncope
- Cerebellitis
- Intoxication
- Tumour
- Myelopathy

If neurologic deterioration 
- Stat CT Head
- Stat labs: CBC, INR, PTT, fibrinogen, type and cross
- Prepare 6 to 8 units cryoprecipitate  (1unit/5kg) (fibrinogen and factor VIII)
- Prepare 6 to 8 units of platelets (1unit/5kg)

Consult neurosurgery if signs of elevated ICP
or CT reveals bleed or mass effect
If inserting urinary catheter consider inserting prior to alteplase administration
If patient displays the following symptoms:
q15min for 1 hour, then q1h for 8 hour, then q2h including assessment for angioedema (tongue swelling) at initiation of alteplase then reassess
T;N, Indications: Post Stroke (Cardiac Workup), Duration: At MD Discretion, Level of Monitoring: Class 1 Monitor At all times
For 24 hours post alteplase administration and physician to reassess within 12 to 24 hours of alteplase administration
Do not elevate, Ischemic stroke / TIA and NOT at risk of aspiration or oxygen desaturation
30 degrees, Refractory high blood pressure, large completed ischemic infarct, elevated intracranial pressure
For 3 hours post alteplase administration then reassess
Select medications using blood pressure levels by Age and Height Percentile
No NSAIDS (e.g. ketorolac, ibuprofen), IM injections, heparin, warfarin, ASA, ticlopidine, ticagrelor, or clopidogrel for the first 24 hours after alteplase administration
No NSAIDS (e.g. ketorolac, ibuprofen), IM injections or heparin, warfarin, ASA, ticlopidine, ticagrelor, or clopidogrel for the first 24 hours after alteplase (tPA) administration
0.1 mg/kg, PO, q8h, PRN hypertension, drug form: tab
0.1 mg/kg, PO, q8h, PRN hypertension, drug form: oral liq
0.1 mg/kg, IV, q10min, PRN hypertension, administer over: 2 minute, drug form: inj
1 mg/kg, IV, q10min, PRN hypertension, administer over: 2 minute, drug form: inj
0.1 mg/kg, IV, q6h, PRN hypertension, drug form: inj
0.2mg/kg, IV, q6h, PRN hypertension, drug form: inj
These alteplase orders represents a total dose of 0.9 mg/kg, with 10% given as a loading dose and the remainder as an infusion.
0.09 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 1 minute, drug form: inj
9 mg, IV, once, administer over: 1 minute, drug form: inj
0.81 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: inj
81 mg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: inj
1 mg/kg, IV, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
0.5 mg/kg, IV, q12h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
1 mg/kg, IV, q12h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
PED TM Fibrinogen Replacement Transfusion (Cryopercipitate / Fibrinogen Concentrate) (Module)
STAT, Speical Insturctions: Book 24 hour post alteplase administration
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
